author: Sharon Udasin
description: Exposure to a common agricultural contaminant in drinking water, even in small doses, may be linked to increased risks of preterm birth, a new study has found. The pollutant, called nitrate, is also associated with low birth weight in infants whose mothers consumed affected water during pregnancy, according to the study, published on Wednesday in PLOS Water....
title: Agricultural contaminants in drinking water linked to higher preterm birth rates: Study

description: The Trump administration is considering deregulation of electric utilities to increase competition and supply, but deregulation has failed to bring online enough new electric generation and has led to overcharging customers and subsidies for older power plants.
